definitions: To follow the trail or scent of (a person or animal).
To follow the course or development of (something).
To make a path or trail through (something).
To move in a group or line.
To leave footprints or marks on a surface.
examples: The hunters tracked the deer through the snow.
We tracked the progress of the project.
The explorers tracked through the dense jungle.
The students tracked into the classroom.
Don't track mud all over the clean floor.
